articles.author: Story by Reuters
articles.title: Pakistan toughens rape law after outcry over attacks
articles.description: Pakistan introduced a rape law on Tuesday that will create special courts to try cases within four months, after protests over the gang rape of a woman whose car ran out of fuel.

articles.description: South Korean health officials have warned residents to take current restrictions seriously, as the country faces the possibility of entering into its first potential lockdown since the beginning of the pandemic amid an alarming rise in new infections.

articles.author: Kay Jones and Amanda Jackson, CNN
articles.title: A 107-year-old Minnesota woman beats Covid-19
articles.description: Tillie Dybing is a survivor. At the age of 107 the Minnesota woman recently beat covid-19 after being diagnosed this fall, according to officials at the Ecumen Detroit Lakes community home, where she has lived since 2015.

articles.title: Public health official on why he resigned: This was the last straw
articles.description: Dr. Jennifer Bacani McKenney and Dr. Gianfranco Pezzino discuss the challenges they've faced as public health officials in their state of Kansas, and why Dr. Pezzino decided to resign as Shawnee County health officer.

articles.title: Utah university board votes to drop 'Dixie' from name after recent grads worried it affected job prospects
articles.description: Dixie State University in Utah is considering a name change after a recent study found the school's name had negative connotations and affected students and alumni looking for job opportunities outside the state.
